pitch.cc: Carlos Marmol may prefer to go after Joaquin Arias, whose OPS is .613 this season, with the two-seam fastball rather than facing Josh Thole, whose OPS is .758.
That was pitch number 15 for Carlos Marmol; his effectiveness may start slipping, as he holds opposing hitters to a .143 average in the first 15 pitches but they hit .213 off him after that.
